metadata.title: RHSA-2023:6227: qemu-kvm security update (Important)
metadata.description:
Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM) is a full virtualization solution for Linux on a variety of architectures. The qemu-kvm packages provide the user-space component for running virtual machines that use KVM.

Security Fix(es):

* QEMU: VNC: improper I/O watch removal in TLS handshake can lead to remote unauthenticated denial of service (CVE-2023-3354)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

bugzilla.text: improper I/O watch removal in TLS handshake can lead to remote unauthenticated denial of service

platform: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 Extended Update Support
